headline: Micron’s HBM Pivot And Global Fab Buildout Reshape Its AI Future
summary: Micron Technology is rapidly shifting its focus to high-bandwidth memory (HBM) used in AI infrastructure. The company has sold out its entire HBM chip supply for the current year. Micron is expanding capacity with a new wafer fabrication facility in Singapore and pursuing another fab in Taiwan. The company is winding down its Crucial consumer brand as part of a broader reset toward AI focused products. At a share price of $437.8, Micron Technology (NasdaqGS:MU) sits in a very different...

headline: Why investors should consider these 'specialized' tech stocks
summary: The gold (GC=F) and silver (SI=F) sell-off continued into Monday, but has steadied somewhat. CFM head of macro strategy Christian Dery sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss silver as it relates to the artificial intelligence (AI) build-out and tech stocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Micron Technology (MU) Is Up 6.7% After Launching $24 Billion Singapore NAND Megafab Project
summary: In late January 2026, Micron Technology broke ground on a new advanced wafer fabrication facility within its Singapore NAND complex, a planned US$24.00 billion, 10‑year project that will add 700,000 square feet of cleanroom space to support AI- and data-driven NAND demand from the second half of 2028. This double‑story fab, integrated into Micron’s NAND Center of Excellence alongside its upcoming high‑bandwidth memory packaging plant, underscores how co‑located R&D and manufacturing are...

headline: AI Memory Boom Squeezes Legacy DRAM Supply, Pushing Prices Higher
summary: High-bandwidth memory, or HBM, has become one of the most lucrative niches in semiconductors, benefiting from explosive demand linked to AI model training and inference.
